the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a Kenaanite or inhabitant of Kenaan; by implication, a pedlar (the Canaanites standing for their neighbors the Ishmaelites, who conducted mercantile caravans)
a Perizzite, one of the Canaanitish tribes
I
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
to desolate
I
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

31.brief: to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a sister (used very widely (like brother), literally and figuratively)
